intro: Euadenia alimensis, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It is often found in open woodlands and is an important component of the Australian flora. Euadenia alimensis is also valued for its ecological role in nitrogen fixation and as a source of nectar for native pollinators.
